info.title: The virtualized Pensions Test API
info.description:
The Pension Discovery API is an interface that allows for communication with pension providers in order to provide a consolidated view of an individual's pensions.

It currently provides 2 operations , one POST ( pension-users ) that broadcasts the individual's details to the various pension providers and gets a response with a consolidated view of the individual's pensions , including a unique identifier (pension link) for each of those. Then, the second method , GET ( /pensions/{pensionReference) ) can be used to provide the unique identifier as a path parameter and retrieve the full details for the specific pension.

It is an awesome API and now I am going to test how it works !!

post.description: Creates an export for use in promoting the API to a new environment.  The export contains the frontend [VirtualizedAPI](VirtualizedAPI.html), their settings, and all backend [APIDefinition](APIDefinition.html) that are required for the frontend API. post.summary: Deprecates the API.
post.description: Only an API Administrator may deprecate an API, and only _published_ API may be deprecated.  When an API is _deprecated_, the API can still be used, but users will be informed that the API has been deprecated.  Optionally, a **retirementDate** may be set which will schedule the API to be automatically retired and removed from use. If specified, the **retirementDate** should be in the ISO-8601 format of yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ (e.g. 2015-01-01T12:00:00Z).

get.description:
Get the list of applications that are visible to the authenticated user.  The list of applications can be filtered using the expression: field=__field__&op=__op__&value=__value__.  Optionally, you can add a logical operation for all expressions, using the form: &lop=AND|OR.  By default, the logical operation is AND.  Multiple expression filters can be used, specifying field, op, and value for each filter. The __field__ is one of:

apiid
:    Matches the application if the application is using the API, specified by ID

userid
:    Matches the application if the user has explicit access to the application, specified by ID

description
:    The application's description

email
:    The application's contact email address

enabled
:     The enabled state of the application, one of: enabled, disabled

createdOn
:    The date the application was created on, time in ms, e.g.: 1372755998542

name
:    The name of the application

orgid
:    Matches the application if the application is part of the organization, specified by ID

phone
:    The application's contact phone

state
:    The application's current state, one of: approved, pending

The __op__ is an operation and is one of:

eq
:    Equal

ne
:    Not equal

gt
:     Greater than

lt
:     Less than

ge
:     Greater than or equal

le
:     Less than or equal

like
:    Like

gele
:     Greater than or equal to, and less than or equal to; the __value__ should be a lower-minimum and upper-maximum separated by comma, e.g: value=5,10

The __value__ will be compared against the __field__, according to the supplied __op__.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Filter field name.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: Filter operation.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Filter value

500.description: Internal Server Error

get.summary: Convenience method for retrieving all Swagger feeds for all virtualised services.
get.description:
Convenience method for retrieving all Swagger feeds for all virtualised services that are visible to the authenticated user.  The list of APIs can be filtered using the expression: field=__field__&op=__op__&value=__value__.  Optionally, you can add a logical operation for all expressions, using the form: &lop=AND|OR.  By default, the logical operation is AND.  Multiple expression filters can be used, specifying field, op, and value for each filter. The __field__ is one of:

id
:        Matches the API by the specified ID

name
:        Matches the API by the specified name

description
:        Matches the API by the specified description

summary
:        Matches the API by the specified summary

version
:        Matches the API by the specified version

type
:        Matches the API by the specified type. Type can be 'rest' or 'wsdl'

resourcepath
:        Matches the API by the specified inbound path

taggroup
:        Matches the API by the specified tag group

tag
:        Matches the API by the specified tag value

methodtaggroup
:        Matches the API by the specified method tag group, i.e. if the API contains a method that contains a tag group matching that specified

methodtag
:        Matches the API by the specified method tag value, i.e. if the API contains a method that contains a tag value matching that specified

The __op__ is an operation and is one of:

eq
:    Equal

ne
:    Not equal

gt
:     Greater than

lt
:     Less than

ge
:     Greater than or equal

le
:     Less than or equal

like
:    Like

gele
:     Greater than or equal to, and less than or equal to; the __value__ should be a lower-minimum and upper-maximum separated by comma, e.g: value=5,10

The __value__ will be compared against the __field__, according to the supplied __op__.

parameters.name: swaggerVersion
parameters.description: The Swagger version

parameters.name: apiVersion
parameters.description: The Swagger API version

parameters.name: extensions
parameters.description: If true, extensions such as the x-axway object are returned in the Swagger definitions (default=true)

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Filter field name.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: Filter operation.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Filter value

500.description: Internal Server Error

get.summary: Returns the external clients associated with an application
get.description: Returns the external clients associated with an application. External clients are used when authenticating the application through a 3rd party OAuth service

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of application whose external clients are to be returned.

get.summary: Queries a list of frontend API.
get.description:
Returns a list of API that are visible to the authenticated user.  The list of API can be filtered using the expression: field=__field__&op=__op__&value=__value__.  Optionally, you can add a logical operation for all expressions, using the form: &lop=AND|OR.  By default, the logical operation is AND.  Multiple expression filters can be used, specifying field, op, and value for each filter. The __field__ is one of:

name
:      The name of the API

apiid
:      Matches the API if the API is virtualized from the specified backend API

createdOn
:      The date the virtualized API was created on, time in ms, e.g.: 1372755998542

deprecated
:      The deprecated state of the API, one of: true or false

retired
:      The retired state of the API, one of: true or false

state
:      The API's state, one of: unpublished, pending, or published

path
:      The path that services this virtualized API.

The __op__ is an operation and is one of:

eq
:      Equal

ne
:      Not equal

gt
:      Greater than

lt
:      Less than

ge
:      Greater than or equal

le
:      Less than or equal

like
:      Like

gele
:      Greater than or equal to, and less than or equal to; the __value__ should be a lower-minimum and upper-maximum separated by comma, e.g: value=5,10

The __value__ will be compared against the __field__, according to the supplied __op__.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Filter field name.

parameters.name: op
parameters.description: Filter operation.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Filter value

500.description: Internal Server Error

post.summary: Upgrades an existing frontend API to a newer frontend API.
post.description: During an API lifecycle, it is necessary to upgrade users to use a newer frontend API.  The idea being that the old frontend API should be phased-out, and developers should move their applications to use the newer frontend API. This method assigns all organizations and applications the same access to the new frontend API (identified by **upgradeApiId**) that they have to the old API (identified by **id**). Optionally, the old frontend API may be deprecated or retired using **deprecate**, **retire**, or scheduled to be retired using **retirementDate**. If specified, the **retirementDate** should be in the ISO-8601 format of yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ (e.g. 2015-01-01T12:00:00Z).

:      The user's current state, one of: approved, pending

surname
:      The surname of the user

The __op__ is an operation and is one of:

eq
:      Equal

ne
:      Not equal

gt
:      Greater than

lt
:      Less than

ge
:      Greater than or equal

le
:      Less than or equal

like
:      Like

gele
:      Greater than or equal to, and less than or equal to; the __value__ should be a lower-minimum and upper-maximum separated by comma, e.g: value=5,10

The __value__ will be compared against the __field__, according to the supplied __op__.

default.description: Default value for this schema if it is applicable

type.description: The type ex: array , boolean, integer , null , number, object, string

id.description: The ID which is used to identify the API Key. You include it in each request, so it's not a secret.

applicationId.description: The ID which is used to identify an application. You include it in each request, so it's not a secret.

secret.description: Each  API Key ID has a Secret Key associated with it. This key is just a long string of characters that can be used to calculate the digital signature that can be included in requests. Your Secret Key is a secret do not distribute.

enabled.description: Flag disables the API key so can't be used in authentication

createdBy.description: The unique identifier for user that generated the API Key

createdOn.description: Epoch/Unix time stamp when the API key was created

deletedOn.description: Epoch/Unix time stamp when the API key was deleted

corsOrigins.description: The domains to allow access for browser-based clients

APIKey.description: API Manager API Key for use in authenticating applications

pointInterval.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds, between data points

pointStart.description: The time of the first data point in milliseconds

data.description: The a metric measurement at a specific time interval

scopes.description: List of scopes associated with the OAuth protected path

OAuthProtectedResource.description: Scope and prefix information for OAuth protected resource.

name.description: The name of the service listener

id.description: The unique identifier for the remote host

alias.description: A human readable alias name for the remote host

name.description: The host name of the remote host

port.description: The host port of the remote host

createdOn.description: Epoch/Unix time stamp when the remote host was created

createdBy.description: The unique identifier for user that created the remote host

organizationId.description: The organization identifier to which the remote host belongs

maxConnections.description: The maximum number of connections to open to a Remote Host. If the maximum number of connections has already been established, the API Gateway instance waits for a connection to drop or become idle before making another request. The default value is -1, meaning there is no limit

allowHTTP11.description: Enables the API Gateway to use HTTP 1.1 when connecting to the remote host. Default value is false, meaning HTTP 1.0 is used

includeContentLengthRequest.description: If this option is set, the API Gateway will include the Content-Length HTTP header in all requests to this Remote Host. Default value is false.

includeContentLengthResponse.description: If this option is set, if the API Gateway receives a response from this Remote Host that contains a Content-Length HTTP header, it returns this length to the client. Default value is false.

offerTLSServerName.description: Adds a field to outbound TLS/SSL calls that shows the name that the client used to connect. Default value is false.

verifyServerHostname.description: Ensures that the certificate presented by the server matches the name of the remote host being connected to. This prevents host spoofing and man-in-the-middle attacks. Default value is false.

connectionTimeout.description: If a connection to this remote host is not established within the time set in this field, the connection times out and the connection fails. Default value is 30000 milliseconds (30 seconds).

activeTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time permitted between reading successive blocks of data. If the Active Timeout is exceeded, the API Gateway closes the connection. This prevents a Remote Host from closing the connection while sending data. Default value is 30000 milliseconds (30 seconds).

transactionTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time permitted to complete the transaction. Default value is 240000 milliseconds (4 minutes).

idleTimeout.description: The maximum amount of time that API Gateway waits after sending a message over a persistent connection to the Remote Host before it closes the connection. Default value is 15000 milliseconds (15 seconds).

maxReceiveBytes.description: The maximum amount of data the API Gateway can receive per transaction. Default value is 20971520 bytes (20MiB).

maxSendBytes.description: The maximum amount of data the API Gateway can transmit per transaction. Default value is 20971520 bytes (20MiB).

inputBufferSize.description: The maximum amount of memory allocated to each request. Default value is 8192 bytes.

outputBufferSize.description: The maximum amount of memory allocated to each response. Default value is 8192 bytes.

addressCacheTimeout.description: The period of time to cache addressing information after it has been received from the naming service. Default value is 300000 milliseconds (5 minutes)

sslSessionCacheSize.description: Specifies the size of the SSL session cache for connections to the remote host, which controls the number of idle SSL sessions that can be kept in memory. Default value is 32.

inputEncodings.description: Specifies the HTTP content encodings that the API Gateway can accept from peers. Supported encodings: *deflate*, *gzip*. If no encodings are specified the default encoding is applied.

outputEncodings.description: Specifies the HTTP content encodings that the API Gateway can apply to outgoing messages. Supported encodings: *deflate*, *gzip*. If no encodings are specified the default encoding is applied.

exportCorrelationId.description: Specifies whether to add the X-CorrelationID header to outbound messages

loadBalancing.description: Specifies the load balancing algorithm that is performed on connection attempts made to listed host addresses. Supported values: 'roundRobin', 'responseTime'. Default value: 'roundRobin'.

responseTimeDecay.description: Specifies the rate of exponential decline of response times used by the 'Weighted response time' load-balancing algorthim. Default value: 10000 (ms)

addressing.description: Specifies a list of IP addresses that the API Gateway can use instead of attempting a DNS lookup on the host name of the remote host provided

watchdog.description: Specifies a watchdog that can periodically poll the Remote Host to check its availability

info.title: Virtualized Pensions API
info.description:
The Pension Discovery API is an interface that allows for communication with pension providers in order to provide a consolidated view of an individual's pensions.

It currently provides 2 operations , one POST ( pension-users ) that broadcasts the individual's details to the various pension providers and gets a response with a consolidated view of the individual's pensions , including a unique identifier (pension link) for each of those. Then, the second method , GET ( /pensions/{pensionReference) ) can be used to provide the unique identifier as a path parameter and retrieve the full details for the specific pension.

It is an awesome API and now I am going to test how it works !!

post.summary: RetrievePensionList
post.description: User provides their basic details that can be also enriched and retrieves the list of all their pensions, including a unique reference number for each of the pension.

get.description: Retrieve full details of a respective pension

parameters.name: pensionReference
parameters.description: unique identifier of the pension

info.title: Pension-DiscoveryAPI
info.description:
The Pension Discovery API is a an interface that allows for the communication with pension providers in order to provide a consolidated view of an individual's pensions. 

It currently provides 2 operations , one POST ( pension-users ) that broadcasts the individual's details to the various pension providers and gets a response with a consolidated view of the individual's pensions , including a unique identifier (pension link) for each of those. 
Then, the second method , GET ( /pensions/{pensionReference) ) can be used to provide the unique identifier as a path parameter and retrieve the full details for the specific pension.

get.description: Retrieve full details of a respective pension

parameters.name: pensionReference
parameters.description: unique identifier of the pension

post.summary: RetrievePensionList
post.description: User provides their basic details that can be also enriched and retrieves the list of all their pensions, including a unique reference number for each of the pension.

 * The problem cannot be solved by a restart or a bypass or a workaround.

Impact.High.description:
Serious faults that affect productivity or development:
* Production System:
  * Problem where production is proceeding, but in a significantly impaired fashion.
  * The production system is running, but with repeated interruptions.
* Development System:
  * The problem cannot be solved by a restart or a bypass.
  * Halts further development and workaround has not been found.
  * Cannot move product into production and workaround has not been found.

Medium faults:
* Production System:
  * Problems which do not have a significant impact on current productivity.
  * The production system is running, but with limitations.
   * A function in the production system is failing, but there is a bypass available.
* Development System:
  * A function in the development system is failing, but there is a bypass available.
  * Development project can proceed, but in a significantly impaired fashion.
  * A workaround has been found but it is not acceptable.

info.title: Chuck Norris Jokes API
info.description: This OAS3 document (f.k.a. Swagger) describes the Chuck Norris Jokes API, and can be used to import the API into Axway Amplify. You can search through a global list of Universities and drill down to your required results.

get.summary: Retrieve a random joke from a global list of Chuck Norris Jokes.
get.description: Using paramaters such as name and country, the search results can be filtered by the API user.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Retrieve a Chuck Norris Joke from a particular category.

200.description: A JSON array of user names

get.summary: Retrieve a category list of Chuck Norris Jokes.
get.description: Each category can in turn be used to generate a random joke in the /jokes/random method.

200.description: A JSON array of user names

info.description:
The Launch Library API is a product by The Space Devs with an up-to-date database of Spaceflight events. 

While this API is free to use it is subject to rate limiting for non-authenticated requests.

Please use https://lldev.thespacedevs.com for development testing - this endpoint has stale data but is not subject to any rate limits.

If you are interested in a higher rate limit please consider supporting the project on Patreon for access to an API Key.

GET
Return a list of all Launch objects.

FILTERS
Fields - 'name', 'id(s)', 'lsp__id', 'lsp__name', 'serial_number', 'launcher_config__id',
 'rocket__spacecraftflight__spacecraft__name', 'is_crewed', 'include_suborbital', 'spacecraft_config__ids',
 'related', 'location__ids', 'lsp__ids'

MODE
'normal', 'list', 'detailed'

EXAMPLE ?mode=list

SEARCH
Searches through the launch name, rocket name, launch agency, mission name & spacecraft name.

EXAMPLE - ?search=SpaceX

info.title: Experian Customer View (UK)
info.description:
The ConsumerView API lets you obtain the values of up to over 200 subscription-dependent variables and person level propensities held on the Experian ConsumerView database for any UK consumer. You can send a request for a single consumer, household or postcode. If a successful match is found, the best result is returned.

 

You can use the Developer Portal version of the API to send requests with the fake parameter values as shown below. A match returns only a subset of the variables available.

 

  • forename: JOHN
  • surname: SMITH
  • buildingno: 62
  • street: GRAPEFRUITS LANE
  • addressline: 62 GRAPEFRUITS LANE
  • postcode: XX5 3NG
  • mobile: 07123456789
  • email: john.smith@email.com

 

N.B. Authentication for the production version of the API is currently handled by an alternative platform and a different endpoint.

tags.name: lookup
tags.description: You can receive a set of predefined ConsumerView variables defined in your asset for a single target person, household or postcode by supplying the relevant search parameters.

get.description: Supply your username and a valid login token in custom headers for the request; and your client id, asset id, and search parameters in the GET query string. Parameter values should be in all-capitals to maximise the match level, and must not include any spaces or special characters. You must use the POST method for searches which must include parameter values with spaces or special characters.

parameters.name: ssoId
parameters.description: Your username. For the production version of the API you will be notified by email of your username when you register for the Neartime Service.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The token which you received in response to a successful log in request. This is valid for up to 30 minutes after a successful log-in.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Your 5-digit client ID. For the production version of the API you will be notified by email of your client ID when you have been onboarded to the API.

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: The ID of the required asset you want to use. An asset ID is a 6-character alphanumeric string and defines the ConsumerView variables and/or person level propensities to which you have subscribed and may be returned in a matched response. For the production version of the API you will be notified by email of your asset ID when you have been onboarded to the API.

parameters.name: addressline
parameters.description: The first line of the address for a household usually comprising a building number or name and a street or road name. This parameter value almost always contain spaces. Therefore if this parameter is required, use the POST method instead.

parameters.name: buildingno
parameters.description: The number used to identify the building or house.

parameters.name: buildingname
parameters.description: The building or house name. If the parameter value must contain spaces to be identifiable, use the POST method instead.

parameters.name: subbuildingno
parameters.description: The sub building number. This may be used when the buildingname or buildingno is split into individual units such as flats or apartments.

parameters.name: subbuilding
parameters.description: The sub building name. This may be used when the buildingname or buildingno is split into individual units such as flats or apartments. If the parameter value must contain spaces to be identifiable, use the POST method instead.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: The name of the postal road or street. If the parameter value must contain spaces to be identifiable, use the POST method instead.

parameters.name: town
parameters.description: The name of the postal town or city. If the parameter value must contain spaces to be identifiable, use the POST method instead.

parameters.name: postcode
parameters.description: The postcode for the household. For the GET method, all spaces must be removed.

parameters.name: forename
parameters.description: The person's forename.

parameters.name: initial
parameters.description: The single initial letter of the persons forename.

parameters.name: surname
parameters.description: The person's surname.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The consented email address for the person (for a person match) or, if available, a household e-mail address (for a household match).

parameters.name: mobile
parameters.description: The consented mobile number for the person.

variable1.description: A matching ConsumerView variable or propensity (e.g. h_income_band_v3) to which you have subscribed and is available in the asset that you specified in the request. Non-matching variables and propensities are not included in the response.

variable2.description: A matching ConsumerView variable or propensity (e.g. h_equivalised_income_band) to which you have subscribed and is available in the asset that you specified in the request. Non-matching variables and propensities are not included in the response.

variableN.description: A matching ConsumerView variable or propensity (e.g. p_discretionary_income_band) to which you have subscribed and is available in the asset that you specified in the request. Non-matching variables and propensities are not included in the response.

Match.description: The highest match level of the data in the response (PC = postcode match, H = household match and P = person match). Some variables at H and P level may be infilled with a postcode-dominant value (if available). A matched response can only be given if the search parameters you have supplied can be resolved to a single person, single household, or single postcode.

statusCode.description:
Milestone status for shipment
- BOOK_RECEIVED      : Request received but not forwarded to courier
- BOOKING            : Booking sent to courier but not confirmed
- BOOKED             : Booking confirmed by courier (waybill number available)
- CANCEL_RECEIVED    : Request received but not forwarded to courier
- CANCELLING         : Cancelling sent to courier but not confirmed
- CANCELLED          : Cancellation confirmed with courier
- UPDATE_RECEIVED    : Request received but not forwarded to courier
- UPDATING           : Update sent to courier but not confirmed
- UPDATED            : Update confirmed by courier
- IN_TRANSIT         : Courier has picked up the shipment
- DELIVERED          : Courier has dropped off shipment
- VALIDATION_ERROR   : Booking/update request resulted in validation error, Trakcel to provide error codes
- BOOKING_FAILED     : Repeated failure to book via the courier API, times to repeat TBC
- CANCELLING_FAILED  : Repeated failure to cancel booking via the courier API, times to repeat TBC
- UPDATING_FAILED    : Repeated failure to update booking via the courier API, times to repeat TBC
- UPDATED_BY_COURIER : Courier has made a unrequested change to the shipment

info.title: Star Wars API Virtual Frontend
info.description:
This OAS3 document (f.k.a. Swagger) describes the Star Wars API, and can be used to import the API into Axway Amplify.

Now we've added even more fun features, including API docs and linting/badging!

![](https://www.tmforum.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/APIBadge.wShadow.GOLD_.png)
